edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.Deck

  • public class Deck
extends Object
    Author:
    David Scianni. This is the object Deck. The Deck contains an array cards of typeCard and of size DECK_SIZE. The Deck will hold the cards that the game will distribute to the Player and the House. It will contain a 4 of each Card.cardNumber, with a different Card.suit for each.

      This is the array of cards where all the cards in the deck are held.

      This is a constant that determines the size of the deck.

    • Field Detail

      • DECK_SIZE

        private final int DECK_SIZE
        This is a constant that determines the size of the deck. The standard blackjack deck is 52 cards. It is made into a final int so that it will be easier to change if the standard deck size were ever to change.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • cards

        private Card[] cards
        This is the array of cards where all the cards in the deck are held. It is instantiated to be made as size DECK_SIZE.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck()
        The constructor for Deck which will create a temporary int called temp to keep the current location in the cards array. It has two for loops. The first for loop is to add the four AceCards, one of each suit, to the first four entries in the array cards. The second for loop is a nested for loop which will add 12 cards of each suit to the array cards, starting with 2 and ending with 13, which will become the King.

    • Method Detail

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int i)
        This behavior is used to get the Card located at cards[i].
        Parameters:
        i - is sent to determine which card in the array cards is sent.
        Returns:
        the Card at location cards[i].

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        The shuffle behavior will shuffle the Cards within the cards array. It does this by first setting up a temporary Card and a random number generator, r. It also creates an integer variable random to hold the number generated from r. Then it creates a for loop that will run for the length of the cards array. While in the loop, it will create a random number and set that number to the integer variable random. Then it will make the temp Card equal to the current Card, cards[i], and change the current Card to the card at cards[random]. Then it will put the temp card into the slot cards[random]. What this basically does is switch each card in the deck with another one at a random location in the deck.
